data.text:
The city of Khust is a city in the Transcarpathian region in the west of Ukraine, on the border with Hungary and Romania. It is located at the foot of the Borzhava mountain range and has a rich history, culture and natural beauty that can be enjoyed at any time of the year. There are many interesting historical monuments here, among them: Hust castle (XIV century), synagogue (XIX century), St. Joseph’s church (XIX century), Museum of railway technology, Tegethof monument and others.

You can start your excursion from the city center, where there are many monuments of architecture and history. From here you can walk to the Culture and Recreation Park “Heroiv Maidan” – a wonderful place for rest and relaxation. Next, you should visit the Khust castle, which was built in the 13th century and rebuilt in the 17th century.

Khust is also famous for its wineries, where you can taste local wines, which are considered famous not only in Ukraine, but also abroad.

So, if you are going to visit Khust, do not forget to take a tour with a guide who will tell you about all the sights and features of this beautiful city.

Khust castle

Khust Castle is a famous monument of history and architecture located in the city of Khust in Transcarpathia. The castle has a history dating back several centuries, so a guided tour can be an interesting experience for all lovers of history and culture. The castle was built as a Hungarian royal fortress to protect the salt route from Hust Gate and the border areas. Nowadays, only separate fragments of the fortress remain. The ruins of the fortress are located in the beautiful park “Khust Castle”, on a mountain of volcanic origin, which looks quite impressive against the background of the plain.

A number of legends about Count Dracula, who was related to the Drago knightly family, are associated with Hust Castle. According to some sources, the bloodthirsty ruler lived in the fortress for two years. A real fact in the legends about the Khust castle is a well and an underground passage, the creation of which took the builders a little more than 9 years. A well with a depth of 160 meters served as a source of autonomous water supply in the event of a siege.

Hat factory

The Hat Factory in the city of Khust is an enterprise engaged in the production of various types of hats. This factory was established over 100 years ago and has a long history of producing high quality hats. Today, the factory produces hats of various types and styles, producing a variety of handmade hats using quality materials.

The factory is based on the traditions of the craft of making hats, which have been widespread in Transcarpathia since ancient times. The factory uses ancient technologies and materials that preserve environmental friendliness and naturalness to the maximum extent. Customers can choose from a wide range of hats in different shapes, colors and materials. Each hat is handmade using the best traditions and unusual designs.

The factory also offers tours, during which visitors can learn about the hat production process and purchase ready-made products. The Hat Factory in Khust is an impressive place that rightfully deserves the attention of tourists who want to get acquainted with the rich history and culture of Transcarpathia.

Ostrich farm

The farm is located near the city of Khust and is one of the largest of its kind in Ukraine. The farm hosts more than 60 ostriches, which always attract the attention of guests with their appearance and behavior.

During the excursion, the guide will introduce you to the ostriches and tell you about their life and behavior. You will learn how to properly feed ostriches, what types of feed are most useful for these birds. The guide will also tell about the incubation of eggs and hatching of birds.

An excursion to an ostrich farm allows you to see large birds in their natural environment, learn more about the life and lifestyle of these interesting animals, and a good rest in a quiet and peaceful place will be a great option for the whole family. At the farm, you can not only see ostriches, but also spend time on the beautiful grounds, play games and cook delicious meals.

Also, purchasing souvenirs at the farm is an added bonus as they provide a unique opportunity to keep memories of your trip to the ostrich farm in Khust.

Valley of daffodils

The valley of daffodils is an unusual place where from May to the beginning of June you can see a sea of white and yellow daffodils, which are located on the territory of the Mukachiv-Chopsky mountain district. This event is an annual event, so it always attracts the attention of many tourists.

The guide will take you through the valley and introduce you to interesting facts about daffodils and their importance in the culture of Transcarpathia. You will learn about how the narcissus was used as a symbol in Transcarpathian Easter, as well as about the traditions associated with this flower among the people. During the excursion, you will also be able to see the scenery on the outskirts of the valley, enjoy nature and immerse yourself in the atmosphere of Transcarpathia. In order to reach the daffodil valley, it is necessary to walk several kilometers, so the guide will tell you about the correct hiking technique, how to easily cover the distance and enjoy the beauty of the environment.

Do not miss the opportunity to immerse yourself in the world of magical daffodils and the beauty of Transcarpathia!
